summary: This is an email chain from November 2021 between US Marshals and an FBI Special Agent regarding security preparations for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The discussion involves sharing contact information for case agents and addressing a reported threat from an individual in the courtroom.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, identified as a case agent for the Maxwell trial. They provide their contact information to the US Marshals.

persons.name: Detective
persons.context: Mentioned as a case agent, along with the FBI Special Agent, for the Maxwell trial. Their contact info is shared with the US Marshals.

persons.name: Deputy United States Marshal
persons.context: A Deputy US Marshal from the Protective Intelligence Unit, Southern District of New York, corresponding with the FBI to obtain case agent information and discuss a potential courtroom threat for the Maxwell trial security briefing.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the upcoming trial for which security preparations and intelligence briefings are being conducted by the US Marshals and FBI.

connections.description: Identified as the case agents working together on the Maxwell trial.
Corresponding to share contact information and discuss security matters for the Maxwell trial.
The US Marshal is preparing security briefings and transport for Maxwell's trial.
The FBI Special Agent is a case agent for the trial against Maxwell.

events.title: Reported Courtroom Threat
events.description: An FBI agent dropped off information about an individual allegedly making threats in the courtroom during the Maxwell trial, but did not leave contact details.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Security Coordination
events.description: US Marshals and FBI case agents coordinate contact information and security preparations for the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

keyFacts: US Marshals were preparing security briefings and transport for Ghislaine Maxwell's trial in late 2021.
An FBI agent reported a threat from an individual in the courtroom but initially failed to leave contact information, prompting follow-up from the US Marshals.
The FBI confirmed it was not in possession of Ghislaine Maxwell's passports.
The primary contacts for the trial were an FBI Special Agent and a Detective, both case agents.
